Elaboration: The oracle bone inscriptions are in the form of Natu's "Guanxiong Axe" or "Tiaohat" (see "Other pictures" below), and are a kind of weapon. (Li Xueqin, Xieming Wen) and the late Shang Dynasty oracle inscriptions with later-shaped weapon handle of bamboo strips with " â— " separation. Xie Mingwen believes that the falling off of " â— " may be distorted phoneticization, using " â— " (the first text of " member ") as the sound symbol of " or ". With the addition of decorative pens around the " â— ", the " Tiao " shape has evolved into a " Ge " shape, which is the original version of the " Suo Wen" small seal. Later, the person under false change fonts, and mistakenly territory, country like guise as " or " original meaning or extended meaning, so the " or " will be attached to a knowing word, so "said the text," says: "or , Bang Ye. From the å›— from the Ge, to keep one. One, the land."

" Or " is often used as the name of a person, country, or clan in Jia Jin inscriptions. For example, "Collection" 4268: "Yihaibu, Yongding (Zhen): Ling or come and return." Ji Lao or Lu: "Ji Lao or Zha (composition) Wen Kao Da Bai (Bo) â–¡â–¡."

" Or " is also used as an adverb under the guise of " Zai " and " Yao ". Such as "South Tuen" 2991 + 620 + 2291 "or their child (?) Yu Tian", " baby " is a verb and ritual related to the whole sentence was intended that the glenoid to the farmland once again held the young festival. (Xie Mingwen) [å¦¾å­]ğ§Š’ Pot: "Or [ç›®åˆ] (å¾—)[æˆ·è‡£è´] (è´¤) [å·¦çŠ¬] (ä½) Sima Jia."

" Or " also means region and territory. For example, "Compilation Lost" 690 + "Compilation" 36182: "When you meet (?) the barbarian leads the east or the east." It means that the barbarian leads the army to attack the east. Another example is ã¬Zhong: "It is ten thousand years, and the four ors are guaranteed." Huang Jingui pointed out that the " or " in the inscriptions of the Western Zhou Dynasty is read as " domain ". Dasik further believes that the " or ", "ä§•", "å®€ or" in the Spring and Autumn Inscriptions and even the Guodian Chu Bamboo Slips and Chu Silk Scripts should be read as " domains ", indicating regions and areas, not countries. Such as "Shangbo Bamboo Book One. "Jian Yi" Jian 7: "Wu (four) or (domain) Chuan (Shun)." "Guodian Jian. "Bao Yi" Jian 12 is "Sifang [Chuan Xin] (Shun) Zhi". Both "four-or" and "four directions" refer to the world in general.
